results.title: The Girl from Tomorrow. Ep 1-3
results.creator_credit: Noel Price, Film Australia, Nine Network and Kathy Mueller
results.brief_description: Alana, a lively 13 year old from the year 3000, finds herself stranded in a strange and primitive world when a time-travel experiment goes terribly wrong. She is kidnapped by Silverthorn, a fugitive war-lord from the dangerous and violent times of the year 2500 and they crash land in a rubbish dump in Sydney in the year 1990. Alana crawls from the battered time capsule, leaving Silverthorn unconscious, and escapes with her personal wrist computer P.J. as her only companion. Cold, hungry and frightened, she is discovered by Jenny, a rebellious purple-haired girl her own age and Petey, Jenny’s science fiction obsessed younger brother.

constellations_other.name: Retrofuturism: aesthetic impact of space design on screen culture
constellations_other.description: Humans have long imagined the future, including prospective travel to space and what living life away from planet earth could look like. This extending to designing interiors of domestic spaces and how these have then influenced the aesthetics of screen culture through set building and design.

results.title: Gladiator [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, NBCUniversal, Douglas Wick, David Franzoni, Branko Lustig and Ridley Scott
results.brief_description: Russell Crowe stars as Maximus, a former general accused of murdering Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius. Maximus is forced to become a gladiator, and uses his newfound fame and power to extract revenge.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, NBCUniversal, Douglas Wick, David Franzoni, Branko Lustig and Ridley Scott
results.description: Following the suspicious death of Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, his newly named successor, Maximus (Russell Crowe) - the former emperor’s key advisor and most loyal general, is accused of his murder, leaving Marcus’ scheming son, Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) to take over the throne. As a result of his accusation, Maximus is stripped of his title and position in the army and sold to slave traders, forced to become a gladiator - men trained to fight to the death as entertainment for a paying audience. Using his new fame and power he vows to fight the man responsible for his dishonour. Includes the making of documentary. Cast also includes Connie Nielsen, Derek Jacobi, Richard Harris and Oliver Reed in his final screen role (Reed died before the movie was completed). Awards: winner of 5 Academy Awards including Best Actor (Russell Crowe) and Best Film (2000).
description_for_label: Following the suspicious death of Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, his newly named successor, Maximus (Russell Crowe) - the former emperor’s key advisor and most loyal general, is accused of his murder, leaving Marcus’ scheming son, Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) to take over the throne. results.title: La Vie a L'envers = Life Upside Down
results.brief_description:
An ordinary young Paris office worker suddenly decides to retreat into his own inner world, giving up his loquacious new wife, his friends, work and possessions. He ends up contentedly staring at a blank wall in the bare room of mental clinic. The theme of alienation, a prevalent one in the 1960s, has seldom been explored with such wry wit and sensitivity, although the film’s attitude to its hero remains ambiguous. Awards: Cannes Festival (1964): Critics’ Week Prize ; Venice Film Festival (1964): Prize for the First Work. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Director, Alain Jessua ; writer, Alain Jessua ; photography, Jacques Robin ; music, Jacques Loussier.
Cast: Charles Denner, Anna Gaylor, Jean Yanne, Yvonne Clech, Robert Bousquet, Nicole Gueden, Guy Saint-Jean, Francois Moncey, Jean Dewewer.

results.title: Mayes C Rubeo
results.brief_description: Mayes C Rubeo is no stranger to MCU, having worked on WandaVision and Thor: Ragnarok before Thor: Love and Thunder, but her costume design credentials include some of the biggest blockbusters.

constellations_primary.name: Mayes C Rubeo
constellations_primary.description: Emmy-award winning and Oscar-nominated costume designer Mayes C Rubeo has worked on some of Hollywood's biggest blockbusters, designing costumes for characters and creatures across time, space and everything in between.

results.description:
Costume designer Mayes C Rubeo is no stranger to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). She won an Emmy for her WandaVision (2021) costume designs and previously collaborated with director Taika Waititi on Thor: Ragnarok (2017). They continued their creative partnership on Thor: Love and Thunder’s electrifying, 1980s-inspired aesthetic.

“On a project of this grand scale, it couldn’t function well if all the creative parts were not interconnected,” Rubeo said. “We had creative meetings with the director of photography, Taika, our producers, the creators, visual development, production designers, set decoration, hair and makeup. I mean, when I create a look, I create that whole, cohesive look. It has to be exactly the same DNA, and the only way to get that DNA is through communication.”
description_for_label:
Costume designer Mayes C Rubeo is no stranger to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). She won an Emmy for her WandaVision (2021) costume designs and previously collaborated with director Taika Waititi on Thor: Ragnarok (2017). They continued their creative partnership on Thor: Love and Thunder’s electrifying, 1980s-inspired aesthetic.

“On a project of this grand scale, it couldn’t function well if all the creative parts were not interconnected,” Rubeo said. “We had creative meetings with the director of photography, Taika, our producers, the creators, visual development, production designers, set decoration, hair and makeup. I mean, when I create a look, I create that whole, cohesive look. It has to be exactly the same DNA, and the only way to get that DNA is through communication.”

results.title: Leaps and Bounds – Paul Kelly and the Coloured Girls
results.brief_description: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for Leaps and Bounds (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG.

constellations_primary.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_primary.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

results.title_for_label: Leaps and Bounds – Paul Kelly and the Coloured Girls
results.description: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for ‘Leaps and Bounds’ (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG, which is also namechecked in the song’s opening line. Directed by Mike Bell, Kelly and band were filmed playing on top of the Punt Road silos for the clip which is beloved for its time capsule quality.
description_for_label: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for ‘Leaps and Bounds’ (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG, which is also namechecked in the song’s opening line. Directed by Mike Bell, Kelly and band were filmed playing on top of the Punt Road silos for the clip which is beloved for its time capsule quality.

results.title: Hanimex Rondette 400S 35mm colour slide projector
results.brief_description: “Hanimex Rondette 400S 35mm colour slide projector Made in New Zealand f2.8 projector 8.5mm 230 - 240 V 50CYC A.C. Only 60W Use 12V 50W Iodine Quartz Lamp. Made in New Zealand by Hanimex Manufacturing Ltd. Green guarantee sticker on the bottom: N.Z. No 37229 Housed in original cardboard box. Air New Zealand MELBOURNE destination tag stapled to top of the box. Purchased from Christchurch International Duty Free Shop. 3 slides: - Man in Traditional dress. ‘Taken on Board Rasa Sayang. Handwritten label: BL 23 - Test slide for Reflector Adjustment - Kodachrome transparency of 3 men performing in a band. Standard 36 Han-O-Matic Magazine original box with index printed on outside. Kindermann (Adapter Rachmen) original red cardboard box. 37 Kindermann Adapters for 110 slides. Made in West Germany. Three plastic 110 Film slide viewers Paperwork included: Kodacolour II Film Instructions Hanimex La Rondette 400S QI Instructions Hanimex Magazine Instructions Hanimex Guarantee card”
